column4: ubuntu refuses to recognize my wireless card.... what can i do? i'm using xubuntu edgy and i have a TEW-441PC card (atheros chipset)
i've been pouring over that link for hours now, it's not helping me
i've also used ndiswrapper for the windows XP driver i got on the card's CD, but it said the driver is invalid
anyone? this is a newbie problem, i'm sure if you guys take two min you can solve my problem :(
copy pasted from earlier: ubuntu refuses to recognize my wireless card.... what can i do? i'm using xubuntu edgy and i have a TEW-441PC card (atheros chipset)
try "sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r`" if you havent already
it says 'no wireless extensions' for lo, eth0 and sit0
installs linux restricted package for your kernel another way is sudo apt-get isntall linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r)
ok, how do i do that?
the `` or $() designate a terminal command the `` are not quotes but tildes i think theyre called
it seems like my card is unrecognized so far... nothing i run says it recognizes my card
i tried wrapping the windows XP driver that came on my card's installation CD... it said it was invalid
might be all you need to do.  reboot might be easiest thing now
